name: The Legendary Guardian
description:
Welcome to InDenial Game Studio, here we will craft the best retro-stylized games and prototypes in the hopes of landing that one game you want us to make, and we can all look forward to the process of crafting and developing.  We generally are leaning to showcase games that never had that appropriate follow up, or that remaster that should have came with new modern tech.  Our independent IP's will generally follow the vein of old gameplay and aesthetics, 8-32 bit, CRT classics, that are meant to fill in that want or need of old school gaming nostalgia. 

Our builds here are meant to entertain and show our development process from conception, to prototype, to build and testing, then leave it to you, the public to influence our current direction.

This is a re-envisioning of an old 1988 NES classic "The Guardian Legend", our first game we are looking to explore further into for our development process. The Legendary Guardian is a multi genre bag, filled with top down action, adventure, exploration, and of course shooting. 

Looking for active play-testers to gauge if the idea or concept is "fun".  Fun for us means, it has good game play, you are actively interested in seeing where this project goes, you envision a whole host of possibilities with the current direction, it has a good foundation. Many things in this concept are not ironed out, and there are mostly stand in enemies and objects in this phase, but in starting this company out, I have decided to take a shot with public feedback for my direction before further development on a project would be made. This is the first iteration of the game, we will host 2 more before deciding to continue with this project.

Next Iterative phase will contain some fixed bugs, a revised menu, and a new space shooting level and boss.

Known Bugs:

-Rat mini boss cannot be fought.

-Spider mini boss isn't always as aggressive as he should be, if for some reason the boss isn't there, you will have to exit the room and re-enter to continue.

- A large grouping of SFX going off at once can kill the music.

- If pause menu is never brought up by pressing ESC during gameplay, you will have to exit application by pressing ESC on the Main Menu before restarting, if you game over.
